intro: Elaphrium lancifolium, commonly known as the slender leaf elaphrium, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
